intro: Justicia odontites, commonly known as the toothed justicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking spikes of tubular, two-lipped flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers come in shades of red, orange, and yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
